result.execSummary:
The defendant Le Roux Pretorius was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • OWI (3rd), an unclassified misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 346.63(1)(a).

Charge(s) in this case were read in to this or other case(s). A "read in" charge is a charge that is dismissed as part of a plea agreement, however:

  • The defendant agrees to have the court consider the charge(s) when sentencing for another crime, under Wis. Stats. 973.20(1g)(b); and
  • The defendant cannot be prosecuted for these charge(s) in the future.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

miscConds.notes:
Assessment, treatment, counseling as recommended by agent.  

DNA sample. 

If probation is revoked or discharged with outstanding financial obligations, a civil judgment shall be entered against the defendant in favor of restitution victims and/or governmental entities for the balance due.  All available enforcement actions will be used to collect the debt.  

A copy of the police report has been electronically sent to the probation office.

timeConds.notes: STAY 45 days; SSTOP.  Jail with huber for work/school/treatment or combination; no objection to EMP.

result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Le Roux Pretorius

Case called: 2:35 p.m. 
Clerk: Heather.

22TR1459;

DRI.
COURT GRANTS.

22CM444;
State moves to;
CT 2>>DRI.
COURT GRANTS.
PLEA:
CT 1 (OWI (3rd))>>GUILTY. 

COURT advises defendant of rights (including constitutional rights) & penalties & questions defendant to understanding; 
COURT finds plea & waiver of rights freely & voluntary made; a factual basis & defendant guilty;

COURT ORDERS: SWH for 2 years of probation; CONDITIONS: SSTOP Program; 90 days MCJ, stay 45 days, (must report within 45 days) with huber privileges for work/school/treatment or a combination;  No objection to EMP.  Any vehicle titled or registered in the Defendant's name is subject to IID installation for 28 months. 28 months DL revocation with any administrative credit.  AODA (unless already completed).  Assessments/Treatment/Counseling as recommended by agent; Absolute sobriety from alcohol; Inclusive fine of $2,500.00 and DNA surcharge; DNA sample. 2 days credit.
